item.title: Lza add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Lza add a quote by Henry Ford
item.description: "Whether you think you can, or you think you can't--you're right." -- Henry Ford

item.title: Lza add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Lza add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Lza add a quote by Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni
item.description: "The secret of health for both mind and body is not to mourn for the past, nor to worry about the future, but to live the present moment wisely and earnestly." -- Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

item.title: Lza add a quote by Nicolas Chamfort
item.description: "A day without laughter is a day wasted." -- Nicolas Chamfort

item.title: Lza add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "Tis better to have loved and lost Than never to have loved at all." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: Lza add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "I generally avoid temptation unless I can't resist it." -- Mae West

item.title: Lza add a quote by Bessie Anderson Stanley
Lza add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Lza add a quote by John Milton
item.description: "The mind is its own place, and in itself can make a heaven of hell, a hell of heaven.." -- John Milton

item.title: Lza add a quote by Montaigne
item.description: "When I am attacked by gloomy thoughts, nothing helps me so much as running to my books. They quickly absorb me and banish the clouds from my mind." -- Montaigne

item.title: Lza add a quote by Mark Hoppus
item.description: "the past is only the future with the lights on." -- Mark Hoppus

item.title: Lza add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Lza add a quote by George Washington
item.description: "It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one." -- George Washington

item.title: Lza add a quote by Dalai Lama XIV
item.description: "Silence is sometimes the best answer" -- Dalai Lama XIV

item.title: Lza add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom." -- Aristotle

item.title: Lza add a quote by Jimi Hendrix
item.description: "When the power of love overcomes the love of power, the world will know peace." -- Jimi Hendrix

item.title: Lza add a quote by Katherine Mansfield
item.description: "The pleasure of all reading is doubled when one lives with another who shares the same books." -- Katherine Mansfield

item.title: Lza add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Lza add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Happiness makes up in height for what it lacks in length." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Lza add a quote by Rickie Lee Jones
item.description: "You never know when you're making a memory" -- Rickie Lee Jones

item.title: Lza add a quote by Tom Petty
item.description: "Excuse me if I have/some place in my mind/where I go time to time." -- Tom Petty
